data.title: I never said yes to 'Milan Talkies': Shahid Kapoor
data.meta_description: Actor Shahid Kapoor has slammed reports that he has walked out of "Milan Talkies", saying that he never even agreed to do the film in the first place.
data.text:
"When were there reports that I said yes to 'Milan Talkies'? You have to first say 'yes' to something before you can say 'no' to it. I never said yes, then why are people now saying that I have left it? I never confirmed the fact that I am doing the film," the 32-year-old said here Monday at the launch of his song "Gundhi baat" from his film "R...Rajkumar."

"I said that I have been offered the film, I have to meet the filmmakers, go through narrations. Now again there are speculations that I am not doing the film," he added.

Shahid added that he will make an official announcement if he will ever do the film.

"If I am doing the film, I will let you guys know. I don't come and announce all the films that are offered to me because it's not correct to talk about those films. If I am doing a film, I will announce it," said Shahid.

Directed by Tigmanshu Dhulia, "Milan Talkies" is produced by Balaji Motion Pictures.
